Title: AtCoder Regular Contest 194 (Div. 2)
Name: Swap 0^X and 1^Y
Problem Statement:
You are given two strings S and T, each of length N and consisting of 0 and 1, as well as two positive integers X and Y. For i = 1, 2, ..., N, let S_i denote the i-th character of S.
Determine whether it is possible to make S identical to T by repeatedly performing Operations A and B below any number of times (possibly zero) in any order:
- 
(Operation A) Choose an integer i satisfying 1 ≤ i ≤ N-(X+Y)+1, S_{i} = S_{i+1} = \cdots = S_{i+X-1} = 0, and S_{i+X} = S_{i+X+1} = \cdots = S_{i+X+Y-1} = 1, then change each of S_{i}, S_{i+1}, ..., S_{i+Y-1} to 1 and each of S_{i+Y}, S_{i+Y+1}, ..., S_{i+Y+X-1} to 0.
- 
(Operation B) Choose an integer i satisfying 1 ≤ i ≤ N-(X+Y)+1, S_{i} = S_{i+1} = \cdots = S_{i+Y-1} = 1, and S_{i+Y} = S_{i+Y+1} = \cdots = S_{i+Y+X-1} = 0, then change each of S_{i}, S_{i+1}, ..., S_{i+X-1} to 0 and each of S_{i+X}, S_{i+X+1}, ..., S_{i+X+Y-1} to 1.
Constraints:
- 1 ≤ N ≤ 5 \times 10^5
- 1 ≤ X, Y ≤ N
- S and T are strings of length N consisting of 0 and 1.
- All input values are integers.
IO Styles:
Input
The input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
N X Y
S
T
Output
If it is possible to make S identical to T, print Yes; otherwise, print No.

Sample Detail.explanation:
The following procedure can transform S into T:

- First, perform Operation A with i = 2. Now, S = 010011001.
- Next, perform Operation B with i = 6. Now, S = 010010011.
- Finally, perform Operation A with i = 3. Now, S = 011000011.


Thus, print Yes.
It is impossible to make S identical to T. Thus, print No.
